name: Jumbo Fluffy Walnut Apple Muffins
author: Jen Graham
summary: A large fluffy muffin with a sweet buttery topping. My jumbo muffin tins hold 1 cup per muffin, so this is scaled for my tins.
ingredients: 2 cups peeled, cored and sliced apples
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Coat top and insides of jumbo muffin pan with cooking spray, or line with muffin papers
In a large bowl, cream together 1/2 cup butter, 1 1/4 cups sugar, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy
Beat in eggs, one at time
Mix together the 1 3/4 cups of flour, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Stir in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing just until incorporated
Scoop into muffin cups to fill 3/4 full
Lightly sprinkle the tops with cinnamon crumble
To make Cinnamon Crumble:  In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, and 2 tablespoons cubed butter
Mix together using a pastry blender, or two butter knives
The crumble topping should resemble small peas
Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until tops are golden brown, and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
If they are browning too quickly, cover with tin foil
Remove from pans, and cool on wire rack
